Slip-rate based on J.G. traces. Note GEM’s historical earthquake archive suggests an Mw 8.8 here in 1629, whereas Liu and Harris (2013) put it further east.  around Seram. Shear modulus set the same as outer-rise events, on the basis that it is in Oceanic Crust (discussion with JG), although of course the value is uncertain. Possible very low coupling to reflect it might not be active (be careful of the numerical issues if using these coupling priors)

Default values, convergence based on mean value provided by Jono. We use the GCMT Mw 8.1 outer-rise in 2009 in the North for minimum mw_max. Subsequent inversions suggest that event was a mixture of outer-rise and subduction thrust, but anyway we keep the Mw 8.1 here.
